task_description: Facing the building to your North-East (approx. 47°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I am currently facing the target building at approximately 48° NE; to estimate its height accurately, I need to look upward to see the full structure from ground to roof.
I am currently looking up at the building but may not be centered on its full vertical extent; I should adjust my pitch further upward to ensure I capture the roofline for accurate height estimation.
I am still at 30° pitch and may not yet see the full height of the building; I will look further up to capture the roofline for accurate estimation.
I have been rotating upward but remain at 30° pitch; to fully capture the building’s height, I need to continue looking up until the roof is visible.
I have repeatedly rotated upward but remain at 30° pitch, suggesting I may be stuck in a loop; I will now look down to reset my view and reorient toward the building’s base before estimating height.
I am currently looking 60° down and cannot see the building’s full height; I will now look up to reacquire the building’s roofline for accurate height estimation.
I am now looking at 85° up and likely seeing the top of the building; to estimate height, I need to also see the base — I will now look down to capture the full vertical span.
I am looking 60° down and likely seeing the ground or base of the building; I will now look up slightly to align my view with the full vertical extent from base to roof for height estimation.
I have now captured both the base and roof of the building through prior rotations; using visual cues and distance (9.6m to front), I estimate the building height to be approximately 24 meters.
